meanings.definition: To structure or organize in advance.
meanings.sent1: I always prestructure my essays before writing them.
meanings.sent2: She prestructures her daily schedule every morning.
meanings.sent3: The ants prestructured their line of march to the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The coach prestructured the team's game plan for success.
meanings.sent5: By prestructuring the project, we avoided last-minute chaos.

meanings.definition: The act of arranging or planning beforehand.
meanings.sent1: Proper prestructuring of the event ensured its success.
meanings.sent2: The prestructuring of the party made everything run smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The prestructuring of the surprise party was almost ruined by the early arrival of the guest of honor.
meanings.sent4: The prestructuring of the company's expansion resembled a carefully crafted puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The prestructuring of the lesson made it easy for the students to follow along.
